result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott B Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Previously posted bail in the amount of $500 applied to total costs with a reamaining balance of $18 which is to be paid during the term of the probationary period.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  DOC to remove $250 DNA cost upon proof of previous payment.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Defendant to participate in Mental health evaluation and treatment as determind by the Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Scott B Wagner in court with attorney Daryl W Laatsch.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a ? plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

w/conditions no contact with Cornerstone Bank or Miracle Home Builders directly or indirectly.

Defendant Scott B Wagner appears via videoconferencing from Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for public defender respresentation.  Counsel waives the reading of the complaint.  Defendant has been in custody for several months at various locations.  Defendant updated address to a rescue mission address.  The Court finds probable cause.   State recommends $1000 cash bond with conditions.  Counsel requesting status hearing waiving timelimits.  Status hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
